fields.description:
Hi,

I get this error "abort: error: _ssl.c:490: error:140770FC:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:unknown protocol"

I have set my proxy properly, so it is not a proxy error. My Hg version is 2.0.2 and using XP sp3 32 bit.

Suminda
fields.summary: SSL Error
Issue service thinks that commit messages are wiki-formatted (BB-3469)

fields.description:
Hi,

got this error with Git GUI for windows.

and git-upload-pack error + git-receive-pack error with eGIT for eclipse.

fields.description:
Cancer diseases remain among the leading listing of death reasons amongst the residents associated with developed countries.[[http://www.arizona-breast-cancer-specialists.com/cancer-therapy-options/true-beam-for-breast-cancer.html| truebeam]] Whilst bacterial infections of various character can easily get much more serious cost In absolute amounts cancer presents considerable menace even in the society where all the principal dangerous ailments such as t. B or even malaria are under control. This is particularly due to the fact the particular tumor comes in huge variety of forms and various cases are simply just slightly associated with the typical concept of the typical technique of out of control tissue development.\\
This variety of diverse cancer cases signifies that doctors should implement very different engineering any time treating various circumstances. The general number of distinct surgery methods as well as drugs carried out cure cancer is very considerable because of large number of strategies selected in various cases. Though the very basic idea of treatments identity very easy - to apply a number of treatment which will be in a position to remove destructive cells and make restricted damage to usual tissues. Amongst the some other techniques intended to implement this simple technique radiotherapy has particular location. Without a doubt this clearly boasts undeniable benefits within the chemotherapy and also surgery. In cases whenever therapy is not really theoretically achievable with surgical techniques or perhaps is going to be really harmful if chemo is actually applied radiotherapy might provide required results.In every single case of radiotherapy presently there is actually one single concern which establishes the actual way of treatment implementation towards the severe level. This really is risk associated with bad influence regarding radioactive emission on the affected person. This concern is framing a couple of innovative approaches carried out to cancer treatment. The first is classical radiotherapy that generally means exposing patient to centered beams associated with engine performance. This is at present implemented through advanced techniques meant to lessen the general direct exposure associated with healthy issues towards the emission. One of the most fascinating concepts utilized to get to the objective is developing a machine which emits strictly controlled levels of the radiation coming from various directions that enables rays to intersect on one hot spot providing awesome affect to that point and no associated damage to the particular healthy tissues. It is extremely evident that accurate focusing on and sophisticated treatments for the positioning of individual is crucial for efficient performing of this technique. For this reason the entire process is most commonly performed by large devices along with high tech control methods. The perfect illustration of this kind of will be Trubeam device intended for radiotherapy administering.\\
An additional method of dispensing exhaust towards the cancer location is based on managed insertion regarding restricted quantity of energetic capsule which contains some radioactive materials. This technique is called brachytherapy. Due that such elements are usually positioned specifically near the growth overall unfavorable impact on individual wellness is actually decreased to be able to minimum stage that allows achieving good results in short time. This particular advantage is quite essential since interpersonal effects of prolonged and harmful therapy is extremely severe and have negative effect on quality regarding patient’s existence. The actual approach for allows to reduce significantly period needed for recovery and rehabilitation.
fields.summary: Current types of radiation therapy inside oncology

fields.description:
Hi, even after deleting a repository it shows up in the repository list when I click 'Repository' in the menu.\\
cheers,\\
Lenin
fields.summary: repositor is visible even after deleting it

fields.description:
The first and second lines are currently joined which makes it hard to read.

It is pretty standard for the first line of a commit message to be a summary. Since these places like the Newsfeed or Dashboard display a summary of commits from various places, it should follow that standard.
fields.summary: Commit messages in Newsfeed should display only the first line (BB-3453)

fields.description:
I've provided my team direct access; however whenever i create a repo it doesn't automatically give them access. I have to remove the user and add them back in in order to get direct access updated.

Shouldn't direct access should be instant? Is there a reason currently why users don't get direct access immediately?

*How to repeat issue:*

h1. Visit the account https://bitbucket.org/account/
h1. (scroll down to direct access)
h1. Add a user that has direct access
h1. Create a new git repo / or import one
h1. Revisit the account page https://bitbucket.org/account/
h1. Click on the user that has direct access. You'll notice they don't have all repo access yet.
----
Also, when you create a repository you should be able to select the access level (add groups or direct access) If you want to add a team. that's something you want to do in the create repo page:  https://bitbucket.org/repo/create . I'd like to see this as an "advanced fieldset option"  when creating a repo.
fields.summary: Granting Direct Access doesn't allow users to have access to all repos automatically / instantly

fields.description: I should be able to decline a pull request that I made.  We don't seem to be able to do this. I ran into the same odd thing when I first started working with pull requests. A tutorial user brought it up again just recently.
fields.summary: Unable to decline a pull request I made from a deleted fork (BB-15376)

fields.description: Links to issues in the Issue Tracker can be quite long. It would be incredibly handy to have a short link generated automatically for each issue.
fields.summary: Automatic link shortening for issues

fields.description:
When I point the image icon with mouse a strange scroll bar appear on the right; when I click on the icon nothing happens.

I tried to make a screenshot with GIMP but the strange bar is not recorded.

Best regards

JSB
fields.summary: unable to upload project logo (BB-5914)

fields.description:
When i attach an ssh key in the account area (https://bitbucket.org/<user>/<repo>/admin/services/#ssh-keys)  i would like the ability to name the SSH key for that particular machine. Since i have several different machines or vm's with different keys.

Example names: Server, staging, laptop, work, laptop (vm), etc.
fields.summary: SSH key naming

fields.description:
I understand that the readme.md was displayed in the past in the Source tab, as Github does, and moved to the Overview tab. In a posting BB made clear that for now this behaviour will not be changed again.\\
This issue is not about this.

What I propose is to render all MD files, when a user clicks on them. One example where you can see such useful behaviour is here:\\
http://goo.gl/EMv2t (links to a specific commit in a Github project)\\
Click on one of the MD files. They are rendered nicely in my browser. This should be the default behaviour for BB too, I propose.
fields.summary: Render Markdown files when they are selected in the Source tab

fields.description:
On the search tab of a repo it would be useful to see the last date when a file in some subfolder was changed. Currently the date column is empty for folders. Instead of this behaviour I suggest to recurse through the folders (or calculate it from the commits) and find the most current update date and use that one for the corresponding column.\\
This adds more overiew to the source tab and allows to navigate to fresh changes easily, even in deep directory structures.
fields.summary: Fill "Date modified" column on search tab

fields.description: In the search box at the top of the BB website I typed in {{{readme.md}}}, but unfortunately no results showed up. Please let the search go through all data that is available.
fields.summary: Include file names in BB search

fields.description: I just visited http://blog.bitbucket.org/ and wanted to search for postings with some specific keywords. I scrolled up and down but didn’t find a search box. Please make the blog searchable.
fields.summary: Add search field to the blog

fields.description:
Github offers a checkbox "Available for hire" that people can update in their profiles. Their public search API can incorporate this flag.\\
This allowed for the very interesting service http://www.githire.com/about

Btw, I hope that someone will add BitBucket to this search, because otherwise several people will feel inclined to move their public repos over to Github.
fields.summary: Add "Available for hire" flag (BB-3366)
persistant import

fields.description: The reason I prefer git to hg is IntelliJ IDEA's integration with git. Mercurial is almost unusable in IDEA.
fields.summary: allow importing into new git repository

fields.description:
"The URL does not point to trunk."

Hey, I know better what points to trunk! I hold two projects in one repository. Let me just define anything.

Example: https://subversion.assembla.com/svn/REPONAME/trunk/PROJECTNAME
fields.summary: Better explain how to import non-standard SVN repositories (BB-8928)

fields.description: A user commented on the POST Service page that this service is broken. The comment came in yesterday.
fields.summary: User Reporting on Documentation Page that POST Service is Broken

fields.description:
When commenting issues some syntax other than Markdown is used, which itself might be the mostly used format for readme files.\\
Would it make sense to use a JavaScript Markdown implementation and support that format for issues and internal mails too?
fields.summary: Make Markdown the input format for issue tracker and wiki content (BB-351)

fields.description: When I uploaded a bunch of SSH keys it can be very difficult to keep track of them. Yes, the preview shows the last parts and can this way add more information. But it would be much more helpful if I could provide my own comment for new and existing ones.
fields.summary: Optional comments for SSH keys

fields.description:
In the Overview tab my README.md can be displayed. Unfortunately I have no preview of this, so this might take me several commits to get it right. It would be great if you offered a preview, so that I can write my readme directly in the browser, or at least paste it there to see it.\\
For the issue tracker you already provide such a preview (albeit it is not previewing Markdown, but another format).
fields.summary: Add live-preview when editing Markdown files online (BB-3466)

fields.description:
Hi there,

I think it would be a great feature to be able to convert from say Git to Hg on import.
fields.summary: Convert on Import

(In a bugfix I read that this issue should have been resolved since last may.)

fields.description:
When downloading a tag as a .tar.gz, .tar.bz2 or .zip archive, the file is named: "{{{user-repository-hash._}}}", same as when downloading a snapshot referred by hash. It would be nice if the archive (and the included folder) was named "{{{user-repository-tag._}}}".

For example, when downloading https://bitbucket.org/jmb/cseh/get/1.2.0.tar.gz the file is named "{{{jmb-cseh-ad591c014a9e.tar.gz}}}" but I would prefer to get "{{{jmb-cseh-1.2.0.tar.gz}}}".
fields.summary: File name when downloading a tag
Markdown parsing bug when handling parragraph inside lists

fields.description:
Please extend the Hipchat service to allow for assigning value to two additional parameters:

* *notify* : 0 = false, 1 = true. (default: 0)
* *color* : "yellow", "red", "green", "purple", or "random". (default: yellow)

[[https://www.hipchat.com/docs/api/method/rooms/message|The Hipchat API]]

My original request for this broker was based on [[https://bitbucket.org/nskerl/hipchatbroker|this project]]\\
and this [[https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2800/new-broker-hip-chat-bb-1985|BB issue]].

If you would like I can make the change there, however Im not sure you based the Bitbucket Service on this repo or not. It might be easiest for you guys to change directly in your implementation.

Thanks,

Nathan
fields.summary: Extend Hipchat Service (BB-3456)

fields.description:
Bitbucket wants me to specify "Pull from" and "Pull into" fields but I don't have a clue about how to do this: clicking the links just redirects me to the repository source code. And without these fields validation fails so the "pull request" feature doesn't work.

FireFox 9.0.1, Chrome 17.0.963, Mac OS X Lion

Add syntax highlighting for Powershell (BB-3457)

The support@bitbucket.org email address listed on the following page does not work. It says "Message rejected by Google Groups"\\

fields.description:
Arduino is an open-source electronics prototyping platform which is programmed with Arduino programming language, which is basically C but with some syntactic sugar added on top.

Arduino IDE filetypes are text files ending with .ino (new) or .pde (old). At the moment neither of these files are syntax highlighted at all. It would be nice if they were highlighted with C/C++ lexer.
fields.summary: Add syntax highligting for Arduino language ( C/C++ ) (BB-3458)

fields.description:
We are loading the issues of a repository into our database. This works quite well, even all issues need to be loaded to find the updated ones since last snapshot. However, with increasing number of issues this becomes an issue. :-).

So the proposal is to filter the issue REST with a filter "greater than", operator = ">" on the parameter utc_last_updated.

With this filter, we would only load the issues, which have been updated since last snapshot.

Thanks,\\
Markus
fields.summary: [REST] API shall support filtering issues by last updated timestamp  (BB-3361)

fields.description: When I update a file to "downloads" page, if I am using custom domain "http://hg.tonyseek.com/szu-web-assistant/downloads", it will report a 500 error after completed.
fields.summary: 500 error when update to "downloads" page (BB-3461)

fields.description:
I rarely look at the commits list and often look at the source view of my projects. I would like the source view + readme to be the default view upon landing on a repository (a la Github).

Thank you.

fields.summary: Please transform all markdown (.md extension) files regardless of location within repository.

I use my own strong, auto-generated passwords that don't necessarily contain a numeric character.

Please remove the numeric character requirement from passwords.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Remove requirement for number in password

fields.description:

There is some code dealing with windows.console on the page and it has to be somehow incorrect.

fields.description: We're considering bitbucket as a hosting option.  One thing that is an issue for us is having user management integrated with our Active Directory infrastructure.  The overhead and security implications of managing 2 separate sets of users makes it a difficult decision to justify.
fields.summary: Provide LDAP/Acive Directory integration for user management

fields.description:
While I would like to follow some projects, I don't really care who also follow it, or I don't really care about it in a daily base.

Could I disable it on BitBucket? It is really annoying, distracting me from issuses or changsets.
fields.summary: Disable "began/stopped following" on Dashboard

fields.description:
I have created a few tags in my git repository.

{{{\\
$ git tag -l\\
v0.9.10\\
v0.9.11\\
version-0.9.10

$ git status

h1. On branch master
nothing to commit (working directory clean)

$ git push origin\\
Everything up-to-date

}}}

But download page ( https://bitbucket.org/afiskon/pl-vkmp3/downloads ) says the following:

{{{\\
Tags

No tags exist for pl-vkmp3 yet.\\
}}}

Looks like a bug.
fields.summary: BitBucket does not show tags in git repository

fields.description:
GitHub allows to search users by country or programming languages. I find this feature very useful. It would be very nice if BitBucket supported something like this.

For example I would like to follow all users from Russia, who write in Haskell. But i just can't find them.
fields.summary: Support search of users, like on GitHub

fields.description:
Hi - I have 2 users in my bitbucket free account - when I try to add a 3rd, I get an error saying that I'm over my limit.  I thought that the limit on free accounts was 5 users.  Am I missing something?

thanks,

_howard
fields.summary: trying to add a user to free account

fields.description:
I'm sharing links to BitBucket repositories & files fairly often on Google+. Unfortunately, the description that Google+ detects is always the same and the generic "This user is sharing code with you [...]".

It would be so much more useful if you could use the repository's description (when available) instead of the generic one. This would also make the BB pags much more SEO friendly, as they include _relevant_ information in their meta tags.
fields.summary: Use a better meta description for repository pages (BB-2698)

Hi! For some reason I can't push my project to bitbucket anymore.\\

fields.summary: Reset password is not working

fields.description:
HTML entities present in code/source shown in the diff view does not escape HTML entities. They are presented as-is. It may be possible for other HTML constructs to pass by as-is also.

Example:\\
https://bitbucket.org/AMcBain/hexxagon/changeset/e28c6de14d47

This is in contrast to the source code view, which does properly escape such entities.

Example:\\
https://bitbucket.org/AMcBain/hexxagon/src/e28c6de14d47/scripts/model.js#cl-113
fields.summary: Diff view does not escape HTML entities (BB-3344)

fields.description:
For instance, if you filter by a milestone named "XYZ & ABC", the URL produced for the query is

https://bitbucket.org/me/myrepo/issues?milestone=XYZ%20&%20ABC&status=new&status=open

The extra ampersand unsurprisingly messes up the query and the system spits out:

amp;%20ABC: "undefined" milestone: "XYZ " status: "new" or "open"

If you manually alter the URL to the following (URL encoding instead of HTML escaping the ampersand) it works properly:

https://bitbucket.org/me/myrepo/issues?milestone=XYZ%20%26%20ABC&status=new&status=open
fields.summary: Issue Tracker "Build Query" Doesn't URL Encode Ampersand (BB-3351)

fields.description:
Hello,

I have noticed that I can follow myself just by clicking heart icon. As you can see in my profile at https://bitbucket.org/reekenx I am follower of myself and one of my followers are... Me.

I don't think there is any purpose to follow myself ;)

fields.description:
Hello!\\
I've got some private repositories here at Bitbucket. Today, viewing repository list at this URL https://bitbucket.org/repo/mine, I noticed that some of them has followers. I click on the number to view followers but I can see no one following that repository.

What does that number count? Is someone following my private repos?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Someone following my private repos?

fields.description:
cori schlegel  made the following comment on our Keyboard shortcut page:

this may be too many keyboard shortcuts, but it would be brilliant if you could do things like i then + to add a new issue.

I hate hopping over to the trackball for one click amongst a lot of typing.
fields.summary: Add a Keyboard Shortcut for issue creation (BB-3460)

fields.description: It's very convenient to use ``` to block off a section of code in markdown files.  Please add support, like what github does.
fields.summary: Support "```" code-fencing in markdown files (BB-3352)

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm having trouble with deploying a project to AppHarbor as the tarball that the AppHarbor guys are fetching from BitBucket is corrupt.

It looks like it's something specific to a particular repository (my uglybugger.org project) as my others seem to be working fine. It's verifiable outside of AppHarbor, too - just downloading it from the "get source" menu fetches a broken archive.

For an example of the broken tarball, try opening this one:\\
https://bitbucket.org/uglybugger/uglybugger.org/get/245aa0bc8522.tar.bz2

I've tried deleting the repository, re-creating it then pushing all my changes back but I get the same result.
fields.summary: Source tarball corrupt (prevents deployment to AppHarbor) (BB-3353)

After recent updates, I observed that the Cyrillic alphabet (possibly affected and other languages​​) is displayed incorrectly.

Saw this in view commit and in readme file on the home page repository.

Charset used Win1251 Cyrillic and UTF8.

Sorry for my bad English.

fields.description:
please add 'branches' and 'tags' to the 'folded' header of a repository.\\
personally, I use them much more often than 'invite' and 'rss feed'. I believe it makes sense to see them always.\\
Also there is so much free space there that 2 small buttons won't look very 'crowded' at all.

fields.description:
I create wikis in bitbucket and I need to check my wiki pages. But I can NOT find a button on the page that can let list all my pages.

I know I can do it git clone xxxx.git/wiki, but it jsut can be done in my local host. When I need to check all my wiki pages online, Bitbucket can not do that.

Sorry to compare to Github, BB need more enhancement.

Thank you!
fields.summary: How to list all wiki pages in bitbucket website? (BB-3367)

fields.description: When I double click on "Repositories", the list of repositories displayed shows that I have two repositories with a follower count of (2) with the remaining repositories showing only (1).  I only expected to see a count of (1) for all repositories.  When I view the followers, I only see one follower listed (as expected).  The only apparent anomaly is that the display produced by double clicking on "Repositories" is displaying what appears to be an incorrect follower count.
fields.summary: Inaccurate follower count

fields.description:
In current REST API, we can get only brief pull request information (without title, message, and revision) through the events API as the below:\\
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Events

However, it is very useful to users if an API to list recent pull request events with more description is supported. Then, the bitbucket would be widely used with various applications. It will enable the pull request to be one status of jira workflow.
fields.summary: pullrequest listing API is necessary. (BB-2021) (BB-7094)

fields.description:
All I'd like out of the repo list for a user (https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/username/) is the number of followers and forks per repo.

BCLOUD-3315 already mentions that currently the number of followers isn't being shown as advertised by the docs. Could fork count also be added?
fields.summary: Provide fork count in API repo list (BB-3356)

fields.description:
Hi, bitbucket team.

I'm receiving garbled e-mail when I reply to a issue by an email in Japanese.

Thanks,\\
Nobuhiro Nakajima
fields.summary: I'm receiving garbled e-mail when I reply to a issue by an email in Japanese.

fields.description:
example of fetching data for a _public_ repo

{{{\\
$ curl --user zalew:password https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/zalew/django-inbox/\\
{\\
"scm": "hg",\\
"has_wiki": true,\\
"last_updated": "2011-09-13 14:24:35",\\
"created_on": "2010-06-25 21:31:58",\\
"owner": "zalew",\\
"logo": null,\\
"email_mailinglist": "",\\
"is_mq": false,\\
"size": 21657,\\
"read_only": false,\\
"fork_of": null,\\
"mq_of": null,\\
"state": "available",\\
"utc_created_on": "2010-06-25 19:31:58+00:00",\\
"website": "",\\
"description": "Messages between Users.",\\

fields.description:
Some facts:

* I'm using OAuth to authenticate the requests.
* I'm using Zend-OAuth as Http-Client

Now the problem:\\
I load issues from my repos via this url:\\
https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/OWNER/SLUG/issues/\\
Everything works fine.

Now I want to filter the Issues by responsible person:\\
https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/OWNER/SLUG/issues?responsible=NAME

This does only work with repositories created by me. With others I get a Forbidden-Error.\\
The problem occurs if I set other filters or options(like limit or start), too.

I entered the API-Url into a web browser and there this is working.
fields.summary: BitBucket API: Forbidden when filtering foreign repositories

fields.description:
Hi,

since the last changeset\\
[[https://bitbucket.org/site/master/changeset/ffe09802d1aa|ffe09802d1aa]]\\
we cannot pull from the repository.

https://bitbucket.org/BurakObama/hiba-ninja

We always get this error:\\
"Error 500: Internal Server Error"

I tried to strip said changeset but got this error instead:\\
"There was an error while executing the strip task."

Could you please reset the repository to its state before that changeset?

Thank you,

Robert Eckert
fields.summary: Cannot pull from repository

fields.description:
Hello,

I am in the process of submitting a manuscript to a peer-reviewed journal. My problem is that I want to provide the reviewers a way to access a private repository on bitbucket, without making the repository public before publication and without knowing their identity.

All the scripts and datasets used in the analysis described in the paper are available as a hg repository on mercurial. Since it contains datasets that must remain private until the manuscript is accepted, the repository is private and its access is restricted. I plan to set the repository as public after publication; but if I cannot do it now, as I need to prove that the data submitted is novel.

The problem is that if I keep the repository private, the reviewers will not be able to check it. I can not grant them access to a private repo, because I can now know their names.

So, I am asking if there is an official way to provide a temporary access link to a private repo. I can create a new bitbucket account, provide it access to the repository, and provide the access information to the reviewers... but I am not sure if that would break your Terms of Usage.
fields.summary: provide temporary access to a private repo, to allow peer-review process

fields.description: In GitHub I have username "mak-it", it would be cool if I could use the same username also here.
fields.summary: Why it isn't allowed to register a new username with dash?

fields.description: For example, I wanna disable notificating when I leave a comment.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

h1. Go [[https://bitbucket.org/shghs/aui-library/changeset/2008c80937f9|here]].
h1. Click the side-by-side diff button.
h1. Scroll to line 1001.
Result:

A JS error is thrown: O[E] is undefined (bundle.js, line 1098).\\
Chrome does not render lines 1001-1100 of the new (right) revision.\\
Firefox does not render any lines after 1000 in both revisions.
fields.summary: Lazily-loaded side-by-side diffs are not rendered fully (BB-3465)

fields.description:
Hey man, I just wanted to make you aware. I made a git commit which resulted in a 502. I had to manually kill the deploy, but it appears to have pushed out the updates alright. I just wanted to make you aware of the following error:

{{{\\
jcostello@ganesha:~/projects/peerbase$ git commit -m "Index update"\\
[master b3b3ced] Index update\\
6 files changed, 111 insertions(+), 59 deletions(-)\\
rewrite peerbase_media/css/index.css (68%)\\
create mode 100644 peerbase_media/javascript/index_page.js\\
jcostello@ganesha:~/projects/peerbase$ git push origin master\\
Password:\\
Counting objects: 24, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (13/13), done.\\
Writing objects: 100% (13/13), 1.88 KiB, done.\\
Total 13 (delta 7), reused 0 (delta 0)\\
error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 502\\
^C\\
}}}
fields.summary: Received a 502 error on git push (BB-3433)

fields.description: When editing an issue, it appears that the title is meant to be editable.  However changes to the issue title are not saved.  I'm the creator of the issue and should be allowed to do this.
fields.summary: Issue title edits not accepted

fields.description: The red and green arrows appear to be the same color to those of us who are red-green color blind.  The attached file shows an original snapshot of the interface along side a grayscale of the same.  Note how difficult the arrows are to distinguish.  They vary only in hue, not in saturation or value.  Please consider changing one of the colors to make them easier to see.
fields.summary: Issue tracker priority arrows difficult for the colorblind to distinguish (BB-2265)

fields.description:
Hello,

in a non-public repository, we have two users. I am the admin, the other guy has write access. He committed a changeset and I used the comment function in the bitbucket web interface to comment on exactly this commit. Directly after commenting, my comment was visible with beautiful syntax highlighting on the commit page. That was yesterday.

The other guy received my comment as email. Now, we both cannot view my comment anymore in the web interface. In the commits overview, there is this little bubble indicating that a comment has been posted to the commit. After clicking on it, we both just get to the commit page and see

Comments

Add comment »

-- my comment should appear inbetween these two lines, right? It is somehow gone. What's the matter with this?

Thanks,

Jan-Philip
fields.summary: Comment to commit not visible anymore
comment

fields.description:
I tried twice to import our subversion repository and both times it failed.

17:46:17 Svn checkout failed: <class 'bitbucket.apps.async.tasks.ImportExecption'>: Job exceeded maximum execution time.  Killed.

What can I do to resolve this?  It's clearly going to take more than two hours to import, and that seems to be the cutoff.
fields.summary: SVN Import: "Job exceeded maximum execution time. Killed."
